Comparing Two Views

You can use the View Comparison utility window to compare and merge any two views.

To compare two views:

  1. If the first view to be compared or merged is not currently displayed in a view window, display it:

  2. Do one of the following:

    • Select Project > Open from the menu bar.

    • Click the Open Project button from the toolbar.

    The Open Project Wizard dialog opens. If you have not previously logged onto the server configuration, you may be asked to do so.

  3. Select the source view.

    1. Click the Plus sign in front of the appropriate server configuration name to display a list of projects.

    2. Select a project, then click Next. The Open Project Wizard: Select View dialog opens.

    3. Select a view from the hierarchy, then click Finish. This view becomes the source view.

    4. (Optional) Configure the view using View > Select Configuration.

  4. Select View > Compare/Merge from the menu. This action opens the Open Project Wizard dialog. If you have not previously logged onto the server configuration, you may be asked to do so.

  5. Select the target view.

    1. Click the Plus sign in front of the appropriate server name to display a list of projects.

    2. Select a project, then click Next. The Open Project Wizard: Select View dialog opens.

    3. Select a second view, then click Finish. This view becomes the target view.

  6. The View Comparison window now displays the two views. The folder hierarchies are shown side-by-side: the source view appears in the left pane and the target view appears in the right pane.

    7. When you select the source pane, the configuration for that view displays on the status bar. When you select the target pane, the configuration for that view (initially, Current) displays on the status bar.
